sn38.1:1: On one occasion the Venerable Sāriputta was dwelling in Magadha at Nālakagāma. Then the wanderer Jambukhadaka[n.270]Spk: He was Sāriputta's nephew. The name means "Rose-apple-eater."approached the Venerable Sāriputta and exchanged greetings with him. When they had concluded their greetings and cordial talk, he sat down to one side and said to the Venerable Sāriputta:
sn38.1:2: "Friend Sāriputta, it is said, ‘Nibbāna, Nibbāna.’ What now is Nibbāna?"
